games.flashlight

Class Flashlight

  • java.lang.Object
    • other.Screen
      • games.flashlight.Flashlight

  • public class Flashlight
extends Screen
    Subclass of Screen. Represents the drawing surface on which the Flashlight game will occur

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int circradintro 

      • Fields inherited from class other.Screen

      • circradintro

        public int circradintro

    • Constructor Detail

      • Flashlight

        public Flashlight(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> as,
                  java.lang.String question,
                  int seconds,
                  Player p,
                  int conf,
                  java.util.ArrayList<Question> answer,
                  java.util.ArrayList<Question> wronganswers,
                  int index,
                  FBLATriviaTester papp)
        Creates a new Flashlight object with the following parameters
        Parameters:
        as - the answers to the questions in the database
        question - the question this game will test the player on
        seconds - the general speed of the game, used to measure difficulty
        p - the player who will play this game
        conf - the conference/competition this game belongs to
        answer - the answers to this question
        wronganswers - all of the player's incorrect answers from previous minigames
        index - this game's spot in the database, used to track progress
        papp - the PApplet this game will run in

      • Flashlight

        public Flashlight(Question ques,
                  int seconds,
                  Player p,
                  int conf,
                  java.util.ArrayList<Question> answer,
                  java.util.ArrayList<Question> wronganswers,
                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> rightAnswers,
                  int index,
                  FBLATriviaTester papp)
        Creates a new Flashlight object with the following parameters
        Parameters:
        ques - the question this game will test the player on
        seconds - the general speed of the game, used to measure difficulty
        p - the player who will play this game
        conf - the conference/competition this game belongs to
        answer - the answers to this question
        wronganswers - all the player's incorrect answers from previous minigames
        rightAnswers - all the player's correct answers from previous minigames
        index - this game's spot in the database, used to track progress
        papp - the PApplet this game will run in

        public boolean isInCircle(float xx,
                          float yy)
        Parameters:
        xx - the x-coordinate of the point
        yy - the y-coordinate of the point
        Returns:
        true if the point (xx, yy) is inside the flashlight's lit area/field of view
